title: (x) Serif face used for Richard Quay's online resume - Foundry Wilson {Yves}
content:
Hi guys,  
I am trying to find a font that I attached used in a resume, I tried the tool “what is this font” but I cannot find a good match, can you help me?

Thank you very much for any suggestion :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [about\_resume.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011053526/http:/typophile.com/files/about_resume.jpg) | 109.69 KB |

 [‹ Please help me identify this font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011053526/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47852 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Joseph L. Baird Radd K. Ehrman" very elegant sharp serif face - Folkwang {Carl} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011053526/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47447 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Littlemad

comments.content:
If this is [David Quay](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011053526/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/David%252BQuay)’s brother, perhaps we should look in [The Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011053526/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/The%252BFoundry)’s collection. ;^)

I’m pretty sure it’s [Foundry Wilson](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011053526/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/foundry_wilson/wilson_book.html). What do you think?

I hope Mr. Quay considers correcting the spelling/grammar mistakes in his CV before sending it to prospective employers.

”...pervious and current version of Adobe Creative Suit”

“wedsite design”
